name: py-virtualenv
description: virtualenv is a tool to create isolated Python environments.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-backports-entry-points-selectable
dependencies.description:
Compatibility shim providing selectable entry points for older
implementations

dependencies.name: py-filelock
dependencies.description:
A platform-independent file lock for Python. This package contains a
single module, which implements a platform independent file lock in
Python, which provides a simple way of inter-process communication

dependencies.name: py-platformdirs
dependencies.description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir"

dependent_to.name: py-or-tools
dependent_to.description:
This project hosts operations research tools developed at Google and
made available as open source under the Apache 2.0 License.

dependent_to.name: py-pre-commit
dependent_to.description:
A framework for managing and maintaining multi-language pre-commit
hooks.

dependent_to.name: py-poetry
dependent_to.description: Python dependency management and packaging made easy.

dependent_to.name: py-virtualenvwrapper
dependent_to.description:
virtualenvwrapper is a set of extensions to Ian Bicking's virtualenv
tool. The extensions include wrappers for creating and deleting virtual
environments and otherwise managing your development workflow, making it
easier to work on more than one project at a time without introducing
conflicts in their dependencies.

dependent_to.name: py-tox
dependent_to.description: tox is a generic virtualenv management and test command line tool.

dependent_to.name: miopen-tensile
dependent_to.description:
MIOpenTensile provides host-callable interfaces to Tensile library.
MIOpenTensile supports one programming model: HIP

dependent_to.name: py-build
dependent_to.description: A simple, correct PEP517 package builder.

dependent_to.name: bohrium
dependent_to.description: Library for automatic acceleration of array operations
